Testing the waters here to see if there's any interest. I'm still himming and hawing about selling this because I know I'll never find another.

The rifle is a full length Russian Imperial m1891 Mosin Nagant 'three line rifle' chambered for the modern smokeless 7.62x54r. This was a 1917 or 1918 capture by the Finns in the chaos of the Russian revolution. It was also not chopped down into a 91/30 or M39 which is unusual.

The rifle is a 1897 dated Tula on both the receiver tang and original barrel. The stock is in good condition and is a Finnish 2 piece grooved re-work of the original Russian stock. Finish is at a easy 90%+ of a Pre- WWII Finnish arsenal Re-blue. Bore is grayed, sharp rifling, zero pitting or counterbore- not bad for 1897. Typical peened and re-stamped sight markings. SA marked on the left side of the barrel. Bolt is a Remington and forced matched. Butt plate is off by a couple hundred. Pre 1968 import or (bring back?) zero import markings anywhere.
